security: Disclosing the methods and sources used to gather information on these students could jeopardize ongoing intelligence operations, expose informants, and damage relationships with other agencies that provided the information.
summary: This document contains memos and file check results on American students who traveled from the Moscow Youth Festival to China in 1957, detailing their political affiliations and activities.
summary_one_paragraph: This collection of memos and file check results, dated from 1958, details information gathered on American students who journeyed from the Moscow Youth Festival to China. The documents, intended for FE/CE working purposes and marked for destruction before January 1959, summarize the students' political doctrines, affiliations with Communist or left-wing organizations, and personal details gleaned from various sources, including informants and other intelligence reports. The files include information on individuals like Louis Alhonote, Sahag Avedisian, Sally Belfrage, Morris Block, Harry Bloksberg, and others, assessing their political leanings and associations.
title: American Students in China: File Check Results
